description: Gets information about the specific command execution on a single device.

parameters.name: executionId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the command execution. This information is returned as a response of the StartCommandExecution API request.

parameters.name: targetArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the device on which the command execution is being performed.

nested_items.name: executionId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the command execution.

nested_items.name: commandArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the command. For example, arn:aws:iot:<region>:<accountid>:command/<commandId>

nested_items.name: targetArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) of the device on which the command execution is being performed.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the command execution. After your devices receive the command and start performing the operations specified in the command, it can use the UpdateCommandExecution MQTT API to update the status information.

nested_items.name: statusReason
nested_items.description: Your devices can use this parameter to provide additional context about the status of a command execution using a reason code and description.

nested_items.name: reasonCode
nested_items.description: A code that provides additional context for the command execution status.

nested_items.name: reasonDescription
nested_items.description: A literal string for devices to optionally provide additional information about the reason code for a command execution status.

nested_items.name: S
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: S
nested_items.description: An attribute of type String. For example:

nested_items.name: B
nested_items.description: An attribute of type Boolean. For example:

nested_items.name: BIN
nested_items.description: An attribute of type Binary.

nested_items.name: parameters
nested_items.description: The list of parameters that the StartCommandExecution API used when performing the command on the device.

nested_items.name: S
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: S
nested_items.description: An attribute of type String. For example:

nested_items.name: B
nested_items.description: An attribute of type Boolean. For example:

nested_items.name: I
nested_items.description: An attribute of type Integer (Thirty-Two Bits).

nested_items.name: L
nested_items.description: An attribute of type Long.

nested_items.name: D
nested_items.description: An attribute of type Double (Sixty-Four Bits).

nested_items.name: BIN
nested_items.description: An attribute of type Binary. For example:

nested_items.name: UL
nested_items.description: An attribute of type unsigned long.

nested_items.name: executionTimeoutSeconds
nested_items.description: Specifies the amount of time in seconds that the device can take to finish a command execution. A timer starts when the command execution is created. If the command execution status is not set to another terminal state before the timer expires, it will automatically update to TIMED_OUT.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp, when the command execution was created.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp, when the command execution was last updated.

nested_items.name: startedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp, when the command execution was started.

nested_items.name: completedAt
nested_items.description: The timestamp, when the command execution was completed.

nested_items.name: timeToLive
nested_items.description: The time to live (TTL) parameter that indicates the duration for which executions will be retained in your account. The default value is six months.
